intro: Cryptantha nevadensis var. rigida, commonly known as the rigid cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States, particularly found in California and Nevada. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and open habitats, such as grasslands and slopes. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
